hackathon-description-text: Excited for a weekend of networking with the coolest people and mentors, competing for incredible prizes, and coding solutions for the real world? UCSB's 4th annual hackathon is ready for you all... Mark your calendars for January 19th-21st! Students of all backgrounds and skill sets welcome :)

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Software Engineer at Google & Founder of DubHacks

hackathon-rules:
The rules here are dictated by each challenge that you apply for, but there is one general rule:
You cannot submit a codebase that you have worked before the evening of January 19th.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $750 to each team member for up to $3000
The winning team will receive (1) Round-trip tickets provided by Surf Air and (2) Thirty-minute office hour with Y Combinator Partner: Kat Manalac
Raspberry Pi + Pihut Essentials Kit for each team member!
$250 AWS credit for each team member!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS
Best IoT Hack Using a Qualcomm Device

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Guaranteed interviews and Amazon Echo Dots for each member of the winning team!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: LogMeIn Best Use of ML Technologies

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Amazon Echo (2nd Gen.) & Lockheed Martin Swag
A $500 Amazon Gift Card for the winning team
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: AppFolio Best Use of Ruby on Rails

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: F181DH RC Drone Quadcopters for each member on the winning team!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: FastSpring Best Buyer/Seller Experience Using FastSpring API

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Nintendo Switches for each member of the winning team!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Firebase Best Use of Firebase API

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $100 to each team member of the winning team. A ride around SB in a Tesla Model 3. Interviews at Spacex!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best use of Typescript or C#

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Google Home Minis and Chromecasts to each team member of the winning team
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best use of Google Cloud Platform

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: What type of technical challenges did the group deal with?
How unique and innovative is the demo? Can it be found in previous submissions?
How useful is this demo based on the problem they are trying to solve?
Is the project visually appealing? Does the project have a pleasant user experience?
Are you blown away by what you see?
